intro: Margaritopsis pallidinervia, commonly known as the pale-veined margaritopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with prominent, pale veins. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Margaritopsis pallidinervia is often found in tropical forests, growing as an understory plant in shaded environments.
